intro: Cerastium glabellum, commonly known as the smooth mouse-ear cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically has hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It produces small white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Cerastium glabellum is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
